alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:07PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR KEOKUK...WESTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHERN BENTON...WASHINGTON... NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHWESTERN LINN AND IOWA COUNTIES... At 507 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Elberon to near Richland, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Keystone around 510 PM CDT. Van Horne and Keota around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include West Chester, Washington County Fairgrounds, Washington, Shellsburg, Richmond, Kalona, Pleasant Creek State Recreation Area and Riverside. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. These are dangerous storms, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
